intro: Chlorophytum nguluense, commonly known as the Ngulu spider plant, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its long, arching leaves that resemble those of other spider plants. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the warmer months. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Chlorophytum nguluense is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
